original: Lundahl, Harry Sigurd, redaktör, Göteborg, f. 16/10/05 i Hälsingborg av Herman o. Agda L. G. 35 m. Britta Linnéa Davidson. Barn: Ulf f. 36. — Stud:ex. i Hälsingborg 25, stud. v. handelsgymn. där 27-28. Medarb. i Helsingborgs-Posten 28-31, Eskilstuna-Kur. 31-35, Arbetet i Malmö 35-45, Gbgs Handelstidn. sed. 45. På ’sin tid framgångsrik fotb :spelare, landslags-spelare, medl. av Hälsingborgs IF, IFK Eskilstuna, Malmö FF o. BI, led. av Sv. fotb:förb. uttagn:komm. 37-39 o. 40. Resor t. Schweiz o. Holl. 27, Engl. o. Ung. 28, Engl. 29 o. 39, Tyskl., Ital. o. Monaco 31, Polen o. Rumänien 37, Tjeckoslovakien 38, Engl. 39. Skr.: Fotboll-Jul (28), Engelsk ligakalender (30). Hobby: idrott av skilda slag. Sv. fotb:förb. spelarem. o. dess tekn. komm. diplom o. M, Skånes fotb:förb. ftjtG, Sörml. fotb:förb. hedersm., Hälsingborgs IF hedersM o. istora ftjtS.
translated: Lundahl, Harry Sigurd, editor, Gothenburg, b. 16/10/05 in Helsingborg to Herman and Agda L. G. Married Britta Linnéa Davidson in 1935. Children: Ulf b. 1936. Completed upper secondary education in Helsingborg in 1925, studied at a commercial college there from 1927-1928. Worked at Helsingborgs-Posten from 1928-1931, Eskilstuna-Kuriren from 1931-1935, Arbetet in Malmö from 1935-1945, and Göteborgs Handelstidning since 1945. Successful football player in his time, played for the national team, member of Hälsingborgs IF, IFK Eskilstuna, Malmö FF, and BI, member of the Swedish Football Association's selection committee from 1937-1939 and 1940. Traveled to Switzerland and the Netherlands in 1927, England and Hungary in 1928, England in 1929 and 1939, Germany, Italy, and Monaco in 1931, Poland and Romania in 1937, and Czechoslovakia in 1938, England in 1939. Written works: "Football Christmas" (1928), "English League Calendar" (1930). Hobby: various sports. Member of the Swedish Football Association's players' union and technical committee, awarded diploma and M, honorary member of Skåne's football association, honorary member and historian of Hälsingborgs IF.
